item.title: Outside Magdala Tavern. South of main entrance, 19th November
item.description:
The lower branches are so low I have hurt my head on it several times. Please prune lower branch reaching over pavement. This has been reported once already and it’s been an issue for over a year and a half.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, South Hill Park, Belsize Park, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden

item.title: Roadworks, 18th November
item.description:

item.title: Another (third) black bin bag 'residential' rubbish dumped in this area, 18th November
item.description:
On the other side of the road of the Clock House Rd black bin fly tipping... This is the third 'residential' (?) black bag rubbish dumped here I ask again; is this going to be happening more and more ? Is there any way that the council can check CCTV cameras in the area? Also bits of rubbish around it - potentially from the same bag that looks like it is now torn

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is the second 'residential' black bag rubbish dumped here, 18th November
item.description:
This is the second 'residential' (?) black bag rubbish dumped here - is this going to be happening more and more ? Is there any way that the council can check CCTV cameras in the area?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bright light on east side of 1-33 Mandeville Cl, 18th November
item.description:
This was previously reported, marked as fixed when nothing was done. There is a very bright LED light on the east side of 1-33 Mandeville Cl. The light is so bright and travels directly across into properties as far as St Johns Park, creating light pollution. Please can this light be replaced, or directed completely downwards.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vanbrugh Park, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Pick Needed, 18th November
item.description:
Increase in build up rubbish in Hengist, Ethelbert and Horsa Rds especially due to recent storms. Please can the litter lick be done as per your highway agreement which should be every 3 weeks?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hengist Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping since previous report, 18th November
item.description:
A sofa has been added to the one I reported the other day along with some carpet. I received an email saying the issue was resolved but it hasn’t been removed and now more has been added. Please help- it’s getting out of hand- again

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leaside Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council vans parking wherever they want, 18th November
item.description:
Council vans regularly park in positions on Reading Lane which are marked as no parking and no waiting or loading - I have just received a ticket for parking here despite paying for on-street parking. I never have space on the road due to council vans.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Florfield Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Very bad road conditions specially for bicycle riders., 18th November
item.description:
I have been commuting via Shooters Hill Road for almost 5 years now, and all the roads are good (fixed, repaired and some are newly done) but only this part of the road out side Shooters Hill Children's Centre - 398 Shooters Hill Rd, London SE18 4LP and around all the signal crossings is so bad that my bicycles either breakdown or gets puncture the moment I cross this road and only this part of the road is not repaired or fixed since i have been using this road. Kindly request to repair this road please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wricklemarsh Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portman Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster

item.title: Road is corroding forcing cars to hit the curb at speed, 18th November
